cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a novel feature selection method for classification problems, which is a common topic in machine learning and data mining. The paper also mentions text mining as a specific application, which suggests a focus on natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR). Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also deals with high-dimensional and large-scale problems, which are common in data science and computational statistics, suggesting cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions image classification, which suggests cs.CV (Computer Vision) as a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a new feature scaling method, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (AI), suggesting cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as another possible sub-category.
